page.title: 03Ayrshire Dairy Farming (2)
page.content: As well as the Friesian dairy herd there are 140 cattle ranging from the new calves to calving heifers. Among these are 10 Romagnola cattle. This breed,which originated in Northern Italy,is known for its hardiness and ability to withstand wet, wind and cold. The farm is run by Mr.Borland assisted by a staff of three including his son who trained at an Agriculture College. Crops grown at Altonhill are used for cattle_feed,together with bought_in draff, (a by-product of the brewing industry) potatoes and a mix of concentrates_ all calculated to give the cattle a well_balanced diet. Like most modern farms it is highly mechanised:it has an electronic feeding system and a modern rotary milking parlour, installed in 1970 at a cost of Â£18,500.
